summary: Sorghum bicolor, or sorghum, is a grass species grown for its grain. It's a crucial cereal crop worldwide, especially in Africa, and is used for food, animal feed, and ethanol production. Sorghum can grow very tall, up to 13 feet, and has small grains. Some types, known as sweet sorghums, are sweeter and used for syrup and ethanol. It's an annual plant, but some varieties can grow back year after year.
title: Sorghum
